answers.answer: Hi,Are there any headaches associated with this?Your history in the army may be significant here? Was there any previous history of being exposed to loud noises?Any previous trauma or injury to the head?I suggest that you seek consult wih a neurologist. The symptoms of numbness and forgetfulness may be attributed readily to a nerve related cause however, forgetfulness may need to be further evaluated. You need a complete neurological examination and a mental status examination to test memory and cognition.At this point,there may be several differentials such as a cervicogenic or spine related headache. However, other conditions have to be ruled out first.A CT scan may rule out an underlying intracranial involvement. This has to be importantly exluded first.Do you have diabetes , hypertension or a kidney disorder?

No headaches, and the problem comes and goes at will.  I can go all day with nothing or I can go 1 hr then bam it hits me. No trauma that I know of, but many loud booms.  My back  was injured from jumping from planes about 10 years ago in the Army.  I do not have diabeties but everybody in my family from mother to brothers have had diabeties.  But I do not have it at this point.  I have been diagnotics with Anexity and alittle hypertension becasue of the war. But I think I function perfectly well. Only the head problems and the forgetfulness.

question: I am a 42 yr old male who has recently retired from the Army after 24 years of servie.  I have served in 4 wars including Iraq and Afghanistan.   I am having a memory problem coupled with a numb feeling in the back right portion of my head.  I have a Degerative disk diease, and a herniated back  in my L4 L5.  I can see clearly but sometimes my right eye twitches. My main issue is the numb feeling is more and more prevelant and my memory loss I think is getting worse.  Even though I can remember alot and function I forget little things that happen 10 minutes ago or last week   Please somebody help me in trying to figure out what this can be.
title: Numb Feeling in the back part of my head. And forgetfullness
